10: Awful customer service representatives I signed up for a trial class. My daughter enjoyed it. The teacher was clear with instructions and my daughter had no problems understanding her. After the class ended, I signed her up for 8 coding classes. I have never received so many calls and emails from one source, in such a short time, in my entire life!! Their customer service person called and was forcing me to sign up for 48 more classes. When I refused, he had his ‘supervisor’ come on the line and he was even more forceful in trying to get me to sign up for more classes. The next day, I was bombarded with incessant calls. I didn’t pick up, and they just wouldn’t stop calling… so I had to block their number. Now I get daily emails from them demanding a number where they they can reach me. My daughter is happy to do the classes, I find them quite age appropriate… but the customer service of this place sucks big time, and once we are done with the 8 classes, we will not be continuing! The harassment is just awful, and I would not recommend subjecting yourself to such torture. Their customer service people must have been trained by loan sharks in harassment techniques!

9: FALSE PLACEMENT PROMISES
10: FALSE PLACEMENT PROMISES: I am reaching out on behalf of the PGNAB (New Age Banking) 04 Batch with growing concern and disappointment regarding the unresolved issues we have been facing and the lack of communication from your end. Our batch commenced the course in December 2021, which ran from January 2022 to January 2023. While we appreciate the efforts of our faculty members, we continue to encounter significant challenges with the coordination and support provided by the Imarticus team, particularly our course coordinator, Monika Mali. Despite our repeated attempts to seek clarification and support, we have not received any response or acknowledgment from Monika Mali or any other responsible party. This lack of communication has left us feeling neglected and frustrated. Furthermore, the promised placement assistance, which was a crucial aspect of our agreement, has not been fulfilled. We have not received any suitable opportunities or interview schedules within the agreed timeframe of three months post-course completion. This has caused immense disappointment and anxiety among our batchmates. The issues we have faced include: - False promises regarding guaranteed placement assistance as per our agreement. - Lack of proper attendance and support during the course duration. - Delay in scheduling interviews and providing suitable job opportunities. - Unfulfilled commitments and higher fees charged with false promises. - Inadequate communication and lack of transparency from the faculty and coordination team. - Differential fee structures within the same batch, leading to confusion and dissatisfaction.

9: Unresolved Loan Cancellation and Harassment by Imarticus
10: Unresolved Loan Cancellation and Harassment by Imarticus. I am deeply dissatisfied with the service provided by Imarticus in relation to the cancellation of my loan. Despite the approval of my loan cancellation more than two years ago, there has been no progress, and the situation has only worsened. My initial concerns were raised in a review about a month ago, to which Imarticus responded, promising a quick resolution. Unfortunately, there has been no follow-up or progress since then. I have diligently submitted all required documents via email, as per their requests, but there has been no acknowledgment or update on the status of my case. To make matters worse, I am now receiving multiple calls from Credence Finance, the loan company involved, which I consider a form of harassment. This not only reflects poorly on Imarticus's professionalism but also adds unnecessary stress to an already frustrating situation. I implore Imarticus to take immediate action to clear the outstanding amount and resolve this matter promptly. The lack of communication and the delay in processing my loan cancellation is causing significant distress, and I am now contemplating legal action to address this issue. By sharing my experience, I hope others considering Imarticus are aware of the potential challenges they may face. I am profoundly disappointed in the lack of accountability and the failure to provide a timely resolution in this situation.

9: The #1 reason for a great experience was the instructor
10: The #1 reason for a great experience was the instructor. He is very well knowledgeable in the subject matter. He took his time to explain the topic along with providing real-time examples. Also, his patience for some of the students who wanted a slower pace. But, he also reminded them that this is a bootcamp and the pace is much more fluid. He was able to keep folks on track and encouraged engagement. The majority of the students requested that he continue as our instructor for the remaining cohorts. This is my first time with Simplilearn and I am impressed. The only negative feedback is that some of the self-learning materials are outdated when trying to reference them with current prerequisite applications to work on. 10: The course was good, informative with tons of learnings. Course material-wise also it was balanced between theoretical and exercise/experience. My only concern was that the interactive sessions in breakout rooms were mediocre. As there were no ice breakers conducted for the students, very few were comfortable talking to each other in breakout rooms. This needs to improve. Suggestion would be to make all the attendees acquainted with each other and have at least one learning success manager in each breakout room in the initial days.

9: The course content and overall expertise of the lecturer was good
10: The course content and overall expertise of the lecturer was good. However, this program structure (day and times) is not suited to persons who live on the western part of the world (outside of the CDT/IST Time Zones). Classes are set on a Saturday and Sunday for 4-hour durations and if you live outside of that timezone then this arrangement is very inconvenient. Also, I felt that this kind, of course, should be set where during the live classes, time is set aside for individual or group practice of the various topics/concepts being taught. It was very content-heavy where practice would now have to be done on one's own time and I did not find this to be effective for me. I am a hands-on learner new to Data Science and I feel like right there practice would have been more useful to me.

9: I have completed a data analytics certification course with Simplilearn
10: I have completed a data analytics certification course with Simplilearn, and I’d like to share my honest feedback. There were several disappointments that I believe need addressing. False Marketing and Unmet Expectations: The marketing team promised great things for my future, but unfortunately, the reality fell short. The coaching material was substandard, and the overall experience didn’t match the initial hype. Job Assistance and Career Growth: I expected better job assistance after completing the certification. However, the support provided didn’t lead to meaningful job opportunities. It’s essential to manage expectations regarding job placement. Certifications alone won’t guarantee success; practical skills and a strong portfolio matter more, which Simplilearn fails to offer. Self-Work and Free Resources: I realized that building a portfolio and gaining practical experience are crucial steps beyond certification. Many free resources, such as YouTube courses, can supplement formal learning without hefty fees. In summary, there’s room for improvement. Learners should approach it with realistic expectations and supplement their learning with additional resources.

The curriculum was comprehensive, covering both the theoretical foundations and practical applications of machine learning. The instructors were highly knowledgeable and approachable, always ready to answer questions and provide additional resources. The hands-on projects were particularly valuable, allowing me to apply the concepts learned in real-world scenarios. The course also provided a solid grounding in Python and relevant libraries like Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Keras, which are essential for any aspiring data scientist. Moreover, the online platform was user-friendly and the community forum was active, providing a great space for discussion and collaboration with fellow learners. The course assessments were challenging yet fair, ensuring a deep understanding of the material. Overall, this course has significantly boosted my confidence and skills in machine learning, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to advance their knowledge in this exciting field."

9: Hello
10: Hello, my name is Pradumn Singh. I want to share my experience. Before enrolling in their course, they painted a rosy picture and influenced me to take up the course again and again calling me. I enrolled in March 2023 for an MBA in Logistics and Supply Chain, with 6 months of online study at that time i was working at Amazon, Bangalore. and the remaining 1 year in Germany. However, they promised provide to full assistance through my visa file and on campus which turned out to be false. The visa team at upGrad did not review my file properly and my visa got rejected twice. I had to seek help from an agent, costing me 70k. They misled students by assuring a quick course completion and assistance with visa applications to relocate to Germany. Now, I am pursuing the course from India because I have no other choice and it lacks practical knowledge in the online sessions. Based on my experience, Me and my friends regrets getting enrolled at upGrad. I recommend exploring alternative platforms and conducting thorough research before making any decisions, as it could save you both time and money to avoid using any services from Upgard. Doing so may result in unnecessary costs and a waste of time.

9: My experience with Upgrad's digital marketing course was far from satisfactory
10:
My experience with Upgrad's digital marketing course was far from satisfactory. Despite the hefty amount paid, the return on investment fell short by a large margin. One of the most glaring issues was the abysmal placement support. For experienced professionals like myself looking to transition into the digital marketing field, this was particularly disappointing. The lack of personalized guidance and assistance left me feeling stranded and uncertain about my career prospects.Moreover, the course heavily relied on pre-recorded content, constituting a whopping 75% of the curriculum. This not only diminished the interactive aspect of learning but also hindered the acquisition of practical knowledge. As someone eager to gain hands-on experience and real-world skills, this was a major letdown.Overall, I would strongly advise against enrolling in this course, especially for those with prior experience in other industries seeking a career shift into digital marketing. The exorbitant fees simply do not justify the lackluster value and support provided. Upgrad's digital marketing course is a disappointing investment that I cannot in good conscience recommend to anyone.
Date of experience: May 05, 2024

9: Intellipaat is not an institute
10: Intellipaat is not an institute. It's a scam. I wanted to enrol for the Certified Ethical Hacking (CEH) course. I enquired and got a call from one of the course advisors named Shalom. She explained the details but I had a pricing challenge. Then she transferred the call to her manager Rajat. He said that 42000 is the least that we can offer but Intellipaat will give you an AZ500 course too as an add-on. I said I will think about it. I kept on getting calls from Shalom and Rajat. I asked Shalom if they can also provide a GCP course as an add-on to which she said she needs to discuss with management first. She discussed it internally and confirmed that they would give a GCP online course which meant I could avail of the live classes too. I asked her to confirm this in an email and she confirmed in the email too. So, I made the payment and finished my enrollment for the CEH course considering that I would get the other 2 courses too. As soon as I enrolled, Rajat dropped an email to the support team asking them to provide course access to CEH, GCP and AZ500 and they provided the course access. But after a day or 2, he dropped another email asking the support team to remove the access to both GCP and AZ500 courses. He must have thought that I won't notice it. But I saw it immediately and called him. He didn't pick up my call. But after several attempts, he picked up my call and said that we couldn't provide you access to the AZ500 and GCP online course. Our management had denied and they are saying in this money we could only offer CEH. I said, but you confirmed this on call and email too. He said yes I did but now I can't provide the access and my access to both GCP online and AZ500 was removed from my portal. This is how they cheat students. To get the enrollment done, they would say that we would provide some additional courses too. The students would find the additional courses worth it and make the payment even after the fact that they were initially hesitant to make the payment. Now, imagine they are making some commitment via call and email then how can they deny that after a student made payment according to that commitment? This is not only unethical and unprofessional but I would call it a scam. It means that whatever they are saying not only on call but also in the email is all a lie. I urge every student to not enrol with Intellipaat. They are not running a company. I think it's some roadside 'Lala ki dukan'. Please avoid this institute and save your hard-earned money guys. These guys can't be trusted. And, I don't know what kind of classes quality I would get in the classes. If the institute is such the tutors would be like that only. The Intellipaat support team has asked to share the order details so that they can check it. Though I don't have any belief that they would help me out but still; my invoice number is B2C/MAY24/00464 experience on May 16, 2024.

10: Point of view of a foreign student As an expatriate who wanted to fall back on classic Indian IT education, I thought this would be a good choice to upskill. However, the support and the idea of the whole academy is great, but it’s the bulk of learners who spoil the whole experience. I am very sad and how this has turned out to be. I would suggest the Intellipaat management to introduce more rules and discipline in their online classes. This is one of my suggestions. 9: I wish if I could give them in negative
10: I wish if I could give them in negative..... My experience with Intellipat has been extremely disappointing. Despite several attempts to resolve the issue, I have yet to receive a refund back. I initially paid for admission last year but due to unforeseen circumstances, I was unable to attend. I promptly reached out to Ganesh who sold the course to me to request a refund, providing all necessary documentation and information. However, despite assurances that the refund would be processed by the finance team and the escalation team (Samarth and Nischay,) it has now been 6 months and I have still not received my money back. They are now coming up with new excuses that they have not received the money and that the advisor has transferred the money to his personal account and all kinds of baseless talks after confirming receipt of money last year. As a customer, I expect to be treated fairly and with respect, especially when it comes to financial matters. I urge others to exercise caution when dealing with Intellipat, as my experience has been far from satisfactory, it is frustrating and I wonder where the education system is going now. It's disheartening to see such disregard for customer satisfaction and basic business ethics.

The course content was comprehensive and well-organized. The trainer, who had many years of experience in Power BI, did a great job of explaining the concepts in a clear and concise way. He was also very patient in answering our questions and providing us with real-world use cases. I especially appreciated the hands-on exercises that were included in the course. These exercises gave me the opportunity to practice what I was learning and to build my skills. Overall, I would highly recommend the Power BI training program by Intellipat Institute to anyone who is interested in learning this powerful business intelligence tool. Here are some specific things that I liked about the training program: 1. The course content was very comprehensive. I learned about all of the essential aspects of Power BI, from data modeling to report authoring to dashboarding. 2. The trainer was very knowledgeable and experienced. He had a deep understanding of Power BI and was able to answer all of our questions in a clear and concise way. 3. The training program was very interactive. We did a lot of hands-on exercises, which helped me to learn the material more effectively. 4. The trainer provided us with real-world use cases. This helped me to understand how Power BI can be used to solve real business problems.

9: I can't emphasize enough how utterly disappointed and frustrated I am with my experience with Unacademy's Judiciary Exam Preparation course
10: I can't emphasize enough how utterly disappointed and frustrated I am with my experience with Unacademy's Judiciary Exam Preparation course. This review serves as a stern warning to anyone considering enrolling in their services; do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for your educational needs. In June 2023, I was excited to embark on a journey towards preparing for the Uttarakhand Judiciary Exam. With great enthusiasm, I decided to invest my time and hard-earned money into Unacademy's highly-touted three-month live + recorded online class batch, which promised to be the gateway to their success. However, what followed was nothing short of a horrendous nightmare. First and foremost, I paid a hefty sum of ₹9499 for a course that was marketed as a three-month live online class batch. The anticipation was palpable as they eagerly awaited the commencement of their studies. However, the reality couldn't have been farther from the promises made by Unacademy. Instead of the classes I paid for, I was provided with the incomplete pre-recorded lectures and no live classes which they promised. This wasn't what I signed up for; wanting a dynamic, interactive experience of live classes to help her grasp the complex concepts required for the Judiciary Exam. It was evident that Unacademy was using these subpar recordings as a placeholder for their lack of expertise and commitment. As if that weren't infuriating enough, the situation took a turn for the worse when I tried to contact Unacademy for clarification and resolution. Shockingly, Unacademy simply chose to ignore all my pleas for assistance. Emails went unanswered, and phone calls were met with silence. And after non-stop efforts to reach the Unacademy help, they refused to refund the amount, stating no refund policy even when they did not fulfill the purpose for which my hard earned money was given. It is as if Unacademy believes they can take people's money and disappear into thin air without any consequences. Unacademy's actions are not just a disappointment; they are a disgrace. They are cheating students with their empty promises, demonstrating a complete lack of integrity and commitment to their customers. My hard-earned money has been squandered on a service that has proven to be nothing short of a scam. In conclusion, I urge anyone considering Unacademy for their educational needs to think twice. They do not have the caliber or ethics to deliver on their promises. I have been left cheated, disillusioned, frustrated, and her crucial time has been wasted, which also impacted my self-study preparation, and I wouldn't wish this experience on anyone else. Stay far away from Unacademy and save your money for an educational institution that actually values its students and delivers on its commitments.

9: Unacademy is an educational technology company based in Bangalore
10: Unacademy is an educational technology company based in Bangalore, India. Started in 2015, it is one of the platforms offering free education online in India. Unacademy educators consist of experts in their respective fields, including Kiran Bedi, currently Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry and India's first female IPS officer. Background: Unacademy first began as a channel on Youtube in 2010 by Gaurav Munjal. In 2015, Roman Saini, an IAS officer joined Unacademy, and the channel started focusing on UPSC civil service exams coaching. In December 2015, Saini and Munjal joined Hemesh Singh and Sachin Gupta to found the company as its own venture. The company is registered as Sorting Hat Technologies Pvt Ltd. In 2017, Unacademy became one of the largest YouTube education channels with 1.2 million subscribers. In August 2017, Bhavin Turakhia, entrepreneur and founder of Directi, joined the board. In 2018, Munjal, Singh and Saini were included in the India version of Forbes 30 Under 30 for their work at Unacademy. Unacademy is said to have attracted $17 million in various funding rounds from investors including, Sequoia India, SAIF Partners, and Nexus Venture Partners. Services: This online education platform uses videos to teach various subjects to students and these subjects are simplified using diagrams and visuals. Unacademy Learning App was launched in 2016. Unacademy also allows educators to create courses on various subjects through its mobile application, Unacademy Educator. This app allows educators to create lessons in different languages. Formation - 2015. Founder - Gaurav Munjal (CEO), Roman Saini, Hemesh Singh, and Sachin Gupta. Type - Private. Headquarters - Bangalore, India. Services - Online Education. Parent organization- Sorting Hat Technologies. Website - https://unacademy.com. I am in touch with uncademy since last one year and found it very useful. I have learnt many subject from unacademy such as GEOGRAPHY, ENVIRONMENT by ROMAN SAINI, ENGLISH PRONUNCIATION by NEETU etc.

9: Udemy rips off content creators!! A student of mine suggested I upload my course to Udemy
10: Udemy rips off content creators!! A student of mine suggested I upload my course to Udemy, to try and increase reach. It seemed ok, I looked around, and it seemed I should expect 50-60% of the fee. Fine, they do marketing, I do teaching, I like that. Or so I thought. I set up the program, looked all around, including promotions and discounts, everything looked good, put my standard $200 price tag on it. I’ve been building this course and running it for 7 years. $200 is what students pay, so it wasn’t like I was charging more or less. Same price. I got notified a few days later I had 4 students!! Awesome! I login, and see they are giving me $14. Total. Not per student. 4 students in a $200 class, and they want to pay me $14. That is less than 2% of what I set my price at. After reaching out, initially they tried to explain "they have promotions, they sell from 10-200 unless we opt out". As I said, I looked through promotions. That isn’t where THAT promotion is. They have to explain to you how to opt-out, as they automatically opt you in. I still am waiting to hear back on how even 4x10 gets me only $14. They claimed they would look into it, but after a week of “we are busy, please wait”, I explained either pay me the 50% of my full price, or remove my materials. “we are busy, please be patient”. So I then just deleted them. Next day they claim I am violating their student guarantees for pulling my material down. They still never got back to me about how 4 sales of my $200 class, only get me $14. I did message every student who signed up, explaining how Udemy was trying to rip me off. I didn’t want the students to be hurt, but I have a feeling Udemy blocked that message to the students. DO NOT BUY COURSES FROM THEM!! They rip off the creators, giving them peanuts, and expecting us to be happy with it. DO NOT CREATE COURSES ON THEM!! There are many other sites it seems, that do not have this reputation and history, or at least make it so you have to opt-in to these deals. UDEMY IS A SCAM!!

9: I will not subscribed to any paid or free courses on Udemy
10: I will not subscribed to any paid or free courses on Udemy. I have been an Udemy customer for more than a decade. I bought courses and have more than 100 titles that I have archived and used for reference when needed. I got excellent support for getting some discount codes when prices were too high. My purchases were high and also refunds. Refunds were requested because the course did not meet my expectations. Udemy has an apparent and unambiguous refund policy where if you are not satisfied for any reason, a refund will be processed with no questions asked. My recent purchase from Udemy was below standard and an outdated course. I wonder why Udemy cannot vet the instructors for their content. They want to promote some of the offered courses with no quality in mind. My request for a refund has been flagged. Their support process is very cumbersome. I finally managed to speak on a chat with a rep who seemed to understand my predicament and has escalated the issue for a refund. Date of experience: January 27, 2022

9: Not a good option for teachers I published a course in 2020 and honestly didn't have a great experience
10: Not a good option for teachers I published a course in 2020 and honestly didn't have a great experience, the fees are not transparent. For example, one month I sold 60 courses and I only made $300 USD (when my course was supposed to cost $20 USD each) and I referred most of the sales. The organic traffic is really low, from the 60 courses I sold, only 2 were "organic" and the rest were followers of my social media channels. Also, as a teacher, you don't have access to the data of your students (emails). I ended up changing to Kajabi, better service and they are well aware that teaching is also a business so my knowledge is worth more. Date of experience: January 21, 2022

9: Take money
10: Take money, but don't give access I decided to take a course, paid for it, but did not get access. So I opened a support ticket, sent through proof of payment etc. Never heard back. Date of experience: January 19, 2022

9: Terrible Certificates Get some good courses
10: Terrible Certificates Get some good courses, get some bad courses. My main issue is the way certification is displayed for CV's. As this is a review directly to udemy and has nothing to do with instructors on the website. Showing the time of videos on the certificate just looks terrible on a CV and does not include the following. Time when videos needed to be paused to take notes. Some courses examination. Additional research done online as required by some courses and not included in the course itself. As well as the total time of the course being split up into multiple days of study instead of for example a one 8 hour day. Not even to mention lunch breaks etc. All of these factors and more just make us feel the time displayed on the certificate IS NOT the actual time spent on the course. And like mentioned looks terrible on a CV. Date of experience: January 15, 2022

9: Not trustworthy
10: Not trustworthy. Be aware that Udemy fools you from the second you visit their website. Offers that 'only last 1 more day' actually last for the rest of the year and beyond. Every time you visit their website, you get this 'offer' and actually, it's not an offer. (they add 8% before they give discount, you know the trick) Be very aware of what you are buying. We (4 people) have been scouting about 200 courses in the software and media development region. Most 'teachers' are so full of themselves, they actually forget to inform you about the 'do's and don't's' in software development. 42% of the 'teachers' approached, do not respond to questions, they just want (your) easy money. If you are looking for a place to learn about software or media development, this is definitely not the place to go. You're better of searching for stuff you really need on the web. There's like a billion people out there that are glad to help you, for free. Date of experience: January 13, 2022

9: False marketing
10: False marketing, no customer service. Firstly, they are impossible to contact once they have your money. No customer service whatsoever. Secondly, the course that I purchased was billed as a "2021" course on flutter app development. Within the platform a massive change had occurred in March 2020 but as the course was actually made three years ago it didn't deal with this change and it rendered a significant amount of the more advanced content pretty obsolete. So the course was sold on a lie. Finally, I was promised that I could watch the course on my TV. However, as Udemy aggressively pushes cookies my android TV won't let me open their website. So, I want to contact them about this and they have become uncontactable. No email, no Twitter DMs allowed, no telephone support. Not even quick chat. If I can ever get in touch with them to get my refund within the 30 day period I will possibly edit the review but that looks unlikely. They may be a genuine company but they behave in a very scammy way Date of experience: January 10, 2022

9: Nice tool for learning IT subjects I have used Udemy for a couple of years
10: Nice tool for learning IT subjects I have used Udemy for a couple of years, mostly to learn and improve computer programming. I'm really delighted by the possibility to see all the details, including preview videos and reviews of the courses before purchasing them. This is fundamental to make sure you choose the right course, since not all of them are good and up to date. Unfortunately, the certificate you get after completing a course is not recognized, it's just a personal achievement, but what really matters is your actual knowledge. Another big advantage is the fact that you can buy just single courses with no need to pay for an annual or monthly subscription. Overall, I would definitely recommend Udemy, just giving the advise to check the courses well before buying them. Date of experience: January 09, 2022

9: I have a lot of different courses on Udemy
10: I have a lot of different courses on Udemy. Most are really good. There are some that are lacking for some reason or another. But, overall I found a great deal of great content. Date of experience: January 09, 2022

9: Change DNS and make Turkey
10: Change DNS and make Turkey. You will buy at least 90% cheaper. It's a complete fraud. How Does? You will purchase a course. Its price is 100 dollars. What you have to do now is very simple. 1 - Change DNS. (Example: Enter Turkey DNS) 2 - Browse that course again from a different browser. The course price is now $2. Turkey is fighting the economic crisis, and they are selling all courses to this country very cheaply. As a Canadian resident, I have to pay $98 more for the same course. Isn't that stupid? I can buy this course for $2 and sell it to someone else for $50 because those living in Canada will still buy it for $100 if they don't know the DNS change method. Change DNS and make Turkey. You will buy at least 90% cheaper. Date of experience: December 26, 2021

9: I have done two photoshop courses (for free on udemy
10: I have done two photoshop courses (for free on udemy, actually, the second course is still under way). The first by Stephan Koel which is a basic course was pretty good once you got attuned to his English. The second complete course in photoshop is taught by someone with extremely poor spoken English, both grammar and pronunication. She is an awful on line tutor from the CADCIM institute, who keeps correcting herself, and has also submitted some videos which are technically unwatchable. She also offers no explanation for what she does, and it is only suitable to learn parrot style. That said, one or two of the techniques she has shown are proving useful. You have to have a lot of patience to get through this course as some of the lessons may have very little relevance to the general user. This was ok for free, but I am glad I did not pay for this poor verbal presentation.

9: Most of their promotions are a sham
10: Most of their promotions are a sham, they just highlight it as the best sale of the season but when you check most of the popular/high rated courses, the price will never reflect that sale price. When you question them, you will meet with a series of generic responses (their response time is pathetically slow). Even escalations will not lead you anywhere (not sure why they have that provision). They will state that they will do a partial refund but that will never work (refer to many reviews from others - if you are lucky and survive the numerous attempts to get someone to respond, they only offer udemy credits and not give you back the money). Better use other education provider sites that are transparent on their pricing and have better support system. It's way easy to enroll and learn...instead of wasting your time following up with Udemy's support team. They don't even have a phone number to speak to someone....seriously?
